intro: Chamaerhodiola quadrifida, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia and the Arctic. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellowish flowers and has dark green, serrated leaves that are adapted to cold and harsh environments. It thrives in rocky and alpine soils, often at high elevations where few other plants can survive. Chamaerhodiola quadrifida is also known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
